title: Jean Mallot
text: Jean Mallot (born 20 August 1952 in <a href="Nizerolles">Nizerolles</a>, <a href="Allier">Allier</a>) was a member of the <a href="National%20Assembly%20of%20France">National Assembly of France</a>. From the <a href="2007%20French%20legislative%20election">2007</a> to the <a href="2012%20French%20legislative%20election">2012 legislative elections</a>, he represented the <a href="Allier%27s%203rd%20constituency">3rd constituency</a> of the <a href="Allier">Allier</a> <a href="Departments%20of%20France">department</a>, as a member of the <a href="Socialist%20Party%20%28France%29">Socialist Party</a>. Major boundary changes in 2011 reduced Allier's parliamentary entitlement from 4 constituencies down to 3, and the old 3rd constituency was in effect abolished, its name and substantially its place being taken over by the pre-2012 <a href="Allier%27s%204th%20constituency">4th constituency</a>. Mallot chose to retire from the National Assembly at the <a href="2012%20French%20legislative%20election">June 2012 election</a>.
